column4: how do I check if my graphics card is running a Nouveau driver or a proprietary one?
lspci -vvv usually shows driver loaded also
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation Device 1213 (rev a1) (prog-if 00 [VGA controller])
look at the text under it, there should be a line like 'Driver:'
for example mine says 'Kernel driver in use: i915' below the VGA section as im using an intel card
nope.. the text under it has something else, do you mind if i put it on pastebin?
sure go ahead
http://pastebin.com/GuJzS811
you have an intel onboard chip
you will the line here 'Kernel driver in use: i915' thats the driver your using i915
i guess i have an onboard from ivy bridge plus a gtx 670m
yes you do
oh i see now you have two

sorry for being a faggot but do you have any clue of how to make my gtx 670m work? i`ve been trying all the day and the last time i tried to install a driver manually i messed up with the resolution and i had to reinstall my system. jockey dont show any proprietary driver to download.
and Dr_Willis, if it really uses optimus there`s a workround for it i guess (google says so) http://bumblebee-project.org/
i tried to do that earlier with the driver 304.37 which is the latest for gtx 670m
how can i be sure that this card uses nvidia optimus technology?
no clue - i didn't know what optimus technology was until Dr_Willis stated it
